result.execSummary:
The defendant Lonza S. Caudill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lonza S. Caudill is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lonza S. Caudill was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, defendant entitled to 37 days credit, subject to verification.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lonza S. Caudill

records.addlTxt: 2:20 PM Defendant Lonza S. Caudill in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Lonza S. Caudill.  Attorney Matt Allen in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites joint recommendation:Ct 2 dismissed.  Ct. 1: 12 mo probation; absolute sobriety; no use of controlled substance without a valid prescription; random UA's and/or pbt's; AODA and follow through; any evaluation or programing through DOC; no violent, abusive or profane conduct.  Costs waived.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  No contest plea. Defendant sworn by the Clerk. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.  37 days sentence credit if revoked.

1:18 PM Defendant Lonza S. Caudill appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Lonza S. Caudill.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Request for PLEAS.  Court will set this case before the other cases to allow defendant to get probation and then readdress bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:58 PM Defendant Lonza S. Caudill in court, in custody.  Atty Jeffrey Erickson appears via video.   Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Waiver of formal reading of complaint. NG plea entered.  ADA Johnson requests bond modification to allow phone, text and email contact with A.C. and allow in person contact if defendant is in custody only.  Further, request to modify bond similarly in 22CF30.  Court grants request and amends bond as proposed and also adds a no violent, abusive or profane conduct provision.
Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on April 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with A.C. or her residence; absolute sobriety
